TopicTitle: [0.21] Kerbal LiveFeed: Passive Multiplayer Plugin/Client/Server v0.7.1

Articles.Content: Okay, me being lazy and not wantign to go through 30 pages of text: What happens when someone you play with has other mods than you, or even no mods aside from Livefeed?

Okay, me being lazy and not wantign to go through 30 pages of text: What happens when someone you play with has other mods than you, or even no mods aside from Livefeed?

This is me being lazy and telling you to go back through and read.

So I'd like to run this as an upstart job on my Linux server at home... If I run it normally on the command line everything is fine; however I cannot get it to run as an upstart job.

Has anyone managed to get this working?

In my there isn't a port option on the client please help me

In my there isn't a port option on the client please help me

The standard syntax for including a port in the URI is after a colon. e.g. domain.tld:2075

Released a new update. You can now view the last four screenshots for each player (configureable). Also changed the player color algorithm and fixed ship icon jitter.

Servers will need to be updated.
